column4: good morning. i booted from liveCD and tried to write on my fast partition. when i try to chmod folders on that partition it says it does, but actually permissions stay the same. whats wrong there?
FAT has little support for permissions
there are mount options for setting the uid/gid for all files and folders that will then allow you to write as non-root
please pastebin the output of 'mount /tmp/fat' and the output of 'id'
and you can't write to it?
can you pastebin the output of 'touch /tmp/fat/test.txt'?
works now. what was the problem?
since vfat itself doesn't store ownership/permission information, mount options are used for those -- and by default make vfat systems writable only by root
if I were you, I'd double-click on the disk icon in Nautilus to mount it
this is xubuntu liveCD, no nautilus here :-)
thanks a lot, have a nice weekend
